enum.name: MAV_CMD
enum.description: Commands to be executed by the MAV. They can be executed on user request, or as part of a mission script. If the action is used in a mission, the parameter mapping to the waypoint/mission message is as follows: Param 1, Param 2, Param 3, Param 4, X: Param 5, Y:Param 6, Z:Param 7. This command list is similar what ARINC 424 is for commercial aircraft: A data format how to interpret waypoint/mission data. NaN and INT32_MAX may be used in float/integer params (respectively) to indicate optional/default values (e.g. to use the component's current yaw or latitude rather than a specific value). See https://mavlink.io/en/guide/xml_schema.html#MAV_CMD for information about the structure of the MAV_CMD entries

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_WAYPOINT
entry.description: Navigate to waypoint.
entry.param: Hold time. (ignored by fixed wing, time to stay at waypoint for rotary wing)
Acceptance radius (if the sphere with this radius is hit, the waypoint counts as reached)
0 to pass through the WP, if > 0 radius to pass by WP. Positive value for clockwise orbit, negative value for counter-clockwise orbit. Allows trajectory control.
Desired yaw angle at waypoint (rotary wing). NaN to use the current system yaw heading mode (e.g. yaw towards next waypoint, yaw to home, etc.).

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_LOITER_UNLIM
entry.description: Loiter around this waypoint an unlimited amount of time
entry.param: Loiter radius around waypoint for forward-only moving vehicles (not multicopters). If positive loiter clockwise, else counter-clockwise
Desired yaw angle. NaN to use the current system yaw heading mode (e.g. yaw towards next waypoint, yaw to home, etc.).

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_LOITER_TURNS
entry.description: Loiter around this waypoint for X turns
entry.param: Leave loiter circle only once heading towards the next waypoint (0 = False)
Loiter radius around waypoint for forward-only moving vehicles (not multicopters). If positive loiter clockwise, else counter-clockwise

Loiter circle exit location and/or path to next waypoint ("xtrack") for forward-only moving vehicles (not multicopters). 0 for the vehicle to converge towards the center xtrack when it leaves the loiter (the line between the centers of the current and next waypoint), 1 to converge to the direct line between the location that the vehicle exits the loiter radius and the next waypoint. Otherwise the angle (in degrees) between the tangent of the loiter circle and the center xtrack at which the vehicle must leave the loiter (and converge to the center xtrack). NaN to use the current system default xtrack behaviour.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_LOITER_TIME
entry.description: Loiter at the specified latitude, longitude and altitude for a certain amount of time. Multicopter vehicles stop at the point (within a vehicle-specific acceptance radius). Forward-only moving vehicles (e.g. fixed-wing) circle the point with the specified radius/direction. If the Heading Required parameter (2) is non-zero forward moving aircraft will only leave the loiter circle once heading towards the next waypoint.
entry.param: Loiter time (only starts once Lat, Lon and Alt is reached).
Leave loiter circle only once heading towards the next waypoint (0 = False)
Loiter radius around waypoint for forward-only moving vehicles (not multicopters). If positive loiter clockwise, else counter-clockwise.

Loiter circle exit location and/or path to next waypoint ("xtrack") for forward-only moving vehicles (not multicopters). 0 for the vehicle to converge towards the center xtrack when it leaves the loiter (the line between the centers of the current and next waypoint), 1 to converge to the direct line between the location that the vehicle exits the loiter radius and the next waypoint. Otherwise the angle (in degrees) between the tangent of the loiter circle and the center xtrack at which the vehicle must leave the loiter (and converge to the center xtrack). NaN to use the current system default xtrack behaviour.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_RETURN_TO_LAUNCH
entry.description: Return to launch location

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_LAND
entry.description: Land at location.
entry.param: Minimum target altitude if landing is aborted (0 = undefined/use system default).
Desired yaw angle. NaN to use the current system yaw heading mode (e.g. yaw towards next waypoint, yaw to home, etc.).
Landing altitude (ground level in current frame).

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_TAKEOFF
entry.description: Takeoff from ground / hand. Vehicles that support multiple takeoff modes (e.g. VTOL quadplane) should take off using the currently configured mode.
entry.param: Minimum pitch (if airspeed sensor present), desired pitch without sensor
Yaw angle (if magnetometer present), ignored without magnetometer. NaN to use the current system yaw heading mode (e.g. yaw towards next waypoint, yaw to home, etc.).

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_LAND_LOCAL
entry.description: Land at local position (local frame only)
entry.param: Maximum accepted offset from desired landing position - computed magnitude from spherical coordinates: d = sqrt(x^2 + y^2 + z^2), which gives the maximum accepted distance between the desired landing position and the position where the vehicle is about to land

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_TAKEOFF_LOCAL
entry.description: Takeoff from local position (local frame only)
entry.param: Minimum pitch (if airspeed sensor present), desired pitch without sensor
Yaw angle (if magnetometer or another yaw estimation source present), ignored without one of these

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_FOLLOW
entry.description: Vehicle following, i.e. this waypoint represents the position of a moving vehicle
entry.param: Following logic to use (e.g. loitering or sinusoidal following) - depends on specific autopilot implementation
Ground speed of vehicle to be followed
Radius around waypoint. If positive loiter clockwise, else counter-clockwise

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_CONTINUE_AND_CHANGE_ALT
entry.description: Continue on the current course and climb/descend to specified altitude. When the altitude is reached continue to the next command (i.e., don't proceed to the next command until the desired altitude is reached.
entry.param: Climb or Descend (0 = Neutral, command completes when within 5m of this command's altitude, 1 = Climbing, command completes when at or above this command's altitude, 2 = Descending, command completes when at or below this command's altitude.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_LOITER_TO_ALT
entry.description: Begin loiter at the specified Latitude and Longitude. If Lat=Lon=0, then loiter at the current position. Don't consider the navigation command complete (don't leave loiter) until the altitude has been reached. Additionally, if the Heading Required parameter is non-zero the aircraft will not leave the loiter until heading toward the next waypoint.
entry.param: Leave loiter circle only once heading towards the next waypoint (0 = False)
Loiter radius around waypoint for forward-only moving vehicles (not multicopters). If positive loiter clockwise, negative counter-clockwise, 0 means no change to standard loiter.

Loiter circle exit location and/or path to next waypoint ("xtrack") for forward-only moving vehicles (not multicopters). 0 for the vehicle to converge towards the center xtrack when it leaves the loiter (the line between the centers of the current and next waypoint), 1 to converge to the direct line between the location that the vehicle exits the loiter radius and the next waypoint. Otherwise the angle (in degrees) between the tangent of the loiter circle and the center xtrack at which the vehicle must leave the loiter (and converge to the center xtrack). NaN to use the current system default xtrack behaviour.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_FOLLOW
entry.description: Begin following a target
entry.param: System ID (of the FOLLOW_TARGET beacon). Send 0 to disable follow-me and return to the default position hold mode.
Altitude mode: 0: Keep current altitude, 1: keep altitude difference to target, 2: go to a fixed altitude above home.
Time to land in which the MAV should go to the default position hold mode after a message RX timeout.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_FOLLOW_REPOSITION
entry.description: Reposition the MAV after a follow target command has been sent
entry.param: Camera q1 (where 0 is on the ray from the camera to the tracking device)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_ORBIT
entry.description: Start orbiting on the circumference of a circle defined by the parameters. Setting values to NaN/INT32_MAX (as appropriate) results in using defaults.
entry.param: Radius of the circle. Positive: orbit clockwise. Negative: orbit counter-clockwise. NaN: Use vehicle default radius, or current radius if already orbiting.
Tangential Velocity. NaN: Use vehicle default velocity, or current velocity if already orbiting.
Orbit around the centre point for this many radians (i.e. for a three-quarter orbit set 270*Pi/180). 0: Orbit forever. NaN: Use vehicle default, or current value if already orbiting.

Center point latitude (if no MAV_FRAME specified) / X coordinate according to MAV_FRAME. INT32_MAX (or NaN if sent in COMMAND_LONG): Use current vehicle position, or current center if already orbiting.

Center point longitude (if no MAV_FRAME specified) / Y coordinate according to MAV_FRAME. INT32_MAX (or NaN if sent in COMMAND_LONG): Use current vehicle position, or current center if already orbiting.
Center point altitude (MSL) (if no MAV_FRAME specified) / Z coordinate according to MAV_FRAME. NaN: Use current vehicle altitude.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_ROI
entry.description: Sets the region of interest (ROI) for a sensor set or the vehicle itself. This can then be used by the vehicle's control system to control the vehicle attitude and the attitude of various sensors such as cameras.
entry.param: Waypoint index/ target ID. (see MAV_ROI enum)
ROI index (allows a vehicle to manage multiple ROI's)
x the location of the fixed ROI (see MAV_FRAME)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_PATHPLANNING
entry.description: Control autonomous path planning on the MAV.
entry.param: 0: Disable local obstacle avoidance / local path planning (without resetting map), 1: Enable local path planning, 2: Enable and reset local path planning
0: Disable full path planning (without resetting map), 1: Enable, 2: Enable and reset map/occupancy grid, 3: Enable and reset planned route, but not occupancy grid

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_SPLINE_WAYPOINT
entry.description: Navigate to waypoint using a spline path.
entry.param: Hold time. (ignored by fixed wing, time to stay at waypoint for rotary wing)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_VTOL_TAKEOFF
entry.description: Takeoff from ground using VTOL mode, and transition to forward flight with specified heading. The command should be ignored by vehicles that dont support both VTOL and fixed-wing flight (multicopters, boats,etc.).
entry.param: Yaw angle. NaN to use the current system yaw heading mode (e.g. yaw towards next waypoint, yaw to home, etc.).

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_VTOL_LAND
entry.description: Land using VTOL mode
entry.param: Approach altitude (with the same reference as the Altitude field). NaN if unspecified.
Yaw angle. NaN to use the current system yaw heading mode (e.g. yaw towards next waypoint, yaw to home, etc.).
Altitude (ground level) relative to the current coordinate frame. NaN to use system default landing altitude (ignore value).

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_GUIDED_ENABLE
entry.description: hand control over to an external controller

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_DELAY
entry.description: Delay the next navigation command a number of seconds or until a specified time

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_PAYLOAD_PLACE
entry.description: Descend and place payload. Vehicle moves to specified location, descends until it detects a hanging payload has reached the ground, and then releases the payload. If ground is not detected before the reaching the maximum descent value (param1), the command will complete without releasing the payload.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_LAST
entry.description: NOP - This command is only used to mark the upper limit of the NAV/ACTION commands in the enumeration

entry.name: MAV_CMD_CONDITION_DELAY
entry.description: Delay mission state machine.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_CONDITION_CHANGE_ALT
entry.description: Ascend/descend to target altitude at specified rate. Delay mission state machine until desired altitude reached.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_CONDITION_DISTANCE
entry.description: Delay mission state machine until within desired distance of next NAV point.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_CONDITION_YAW
entry.description: Reach a certain target angle.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_CONDITION_LAST
entry.description: NOP - This command is only used to mark the upper limit of the CONDITION commands in the enumeration

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_MODE
entry.description: Set system mode.
entry.param: Custom mode - this is system specific, please refer to the individual autopilot specifications for details.
Custom sub mode - this is system specific, please refer to the individual autopilot specifications for details.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_JUMP
entry.description: Jump to the desired command in the mission list. Repeat this action only the specified number of times

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_CHANGE_SPEED
entry.description: Change speed and/or throttle set points.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_HOME
entry.description: Sets the home position to either to the current position or a specified position. The home position is the default position that the system will return to and land on. The position is set automatically by the system during the takeoff (and may also be set using this command). Note: the current home position may be emitted in a HOME_POSITION message on request (using MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE with param1=242).
entry.param: Use current (1=use current location, 0=use specified location)
Yaw angle. NaN to use default heading

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_PARAMETER
entry.description: Set a system parameter. Caution! Use of this command requires knowledge of the numeric enumeration value of the parameter.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_RELAY
entry.description: Set a relay to a condition.
entry.param: Setting. (1=on, 0=off, others possible depending on system hardware)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_REPEAT_RELAY
entry.description: Cycle a relay on and off for a desired number of cycles with a desired period.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_SERVO
entry.description: Set a servo to a desired PWM value.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_REPEAT_SERVO
entry.description: Cycle a between its nominal setting and a desired PWM for a desired number of cycles with a desired period.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_FLIGHTTERMINATION
entry.description: Terminate flight immediately. Flight termination immediately and irreversably terminates the current flight, returning the vehicle to ground. The vehicle will ignore RC or other input until it has been power-cycled. Termination may trigger safety measures, including: disabling motors and deployment of parachute on multicopters, and setting flight surfaces to initiate a landing pattern on fixed-wing). On multicopters without a parachute it may trigger a crash landing. Support for this command can be tested using the protocol bit: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_FLIGHT_TERMINATION. Support for this command can also be tested by sending the command with param1=0 (< 0.5); the ACK should be either MAV_RESULT_FAILED or MAV_RESULT_UNSUPPORTED.
entry.param: Flight termination activated if > 0.5. Otherwise not activated and ACK with MAV_RESULT_FAILED.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_CHANGE_ALTITUDE
entry.description: Change altitude set point.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_ACTUATOR
entry.description: Sets actuators (e.g. servos) to a desired value. The actuator numbers are mapped to specific outputs (e.g. on any MAIN or AUX PWM or UAVCAN) using a flight-stack specific mechanism (i.e. a parameter).
entry.param: Actuator 1 value, scaled from [-1 to 1]. NaN to ignore.
Actuator 2 value, scaled from [-1 to 1]. NaN to ignore.
Actuator 3 value, scaled from [-1 to 1]. NaN to ignore.
Actuator 4 value, scaled from [-1 to 1]. NaN to ignore.
Actuator 5 value, scaled from [-1 to 1]. NaN to ignore.
Actuator 6 value, scaled from [-1 to 1]. NaN to ignore.
Index of actuator set (i.e if set to 1, Actuator 1 becomes Actuator 7)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_LAND_START
entry.description: Mission command to perform a landing. This is used as a marker in a mission to tell the autopilot where a sequence of mission items that represents a landing starts. It may also be sent via a COMMAND_LONG to trigger a landing, in which case the nearest (geographically) landing sequence in the mission will be used. The Latitude/Longitude is optional, and may be set to 0 if not needed. If specified then it will be used to help find the closest landing sequence.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_RALLY_LAND
entry.description: Mission command to perform a landing from a rally point.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_GO_AROUND
entry.description: Mission command to safely abort an autonomous landing.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_REPOSITION
entry.description: Reposition the vehicle to a specific WGS84 global position.
entry.param: Ground speed, less than 0 (-1) for default
Loiter radius for planes. Positive values only, direction is controlled by Yaw value. A value of zero or NaN is ignored.
Yaw heading. NaN to use the current system yaw heading mode (e.g. yaw towards next waypoint, yaw to home, etc.). For planes indicates loiter direction (0: clockwise, 1: counter clockwise)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_PAUSE_CONTINUE
entry.description: If in a GPS controlled position mode, hold the current position or continue.
entry.param: 0: Pause current mission or reposition command, hold current position. 1: Continue mission. A VTOL capable vehicle should enter hover mode (multicopter and VTOL planes). A plane should loiter with the default loiter radius.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_REVERSE
entry.description: Set moving direction to forward or reverse.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_ROI_LOCATION
entry.description: Sets the region of interest (ROI) to a location. This can then be used by the vehicle's control system to control the vehicle attitude and the attitude of various sensors such as cameras. This command can be sent to a gimbal manager but not to a gimbal device. A gimbal is not to react to this message.
entry.param: Component ID of gimbal device to address (or 1-6 for non-MAVLink gimbal), 0 for all gimbal device components. Send command multiple times for more than one gimbal (but not all gimbals).

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_ROI_WPNEXT_OFFSET
entry.description: Sets the region of interest (ROI) to be toward next waypoint, with optional pitch/roll/yaw offset. This can then be used by the vehicle's control system to control the vehicle attitude and the attitude of various sensors such as cameras. This command can be sent to a gimbal manager but not to a gimbal device. A gimbal device is not to react to this message.
entry.param: Component ID of gimbal device to address (or 1-6 for non-MAVLink gimbal), 0 for all gimbal device components. Send command multiple times for more than one gimbal (but not all gimbals).
Pitch offset from next waypoint, positive pitching up
Roll offset from next waypoint, positive rolling to the right
Yaw offset from next waypoint, positive yawing to the right

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_ROI_NONE
entry.description: Cancels any previous ROI command returning the vehicle/sensors to default flight characteristics. This can then be used by the vehicle's control system to control the vehicle attitude and the attitude of various sensors such as cameras. This command can be sent to a gimbal manager but not to a gimbal device. A gimbal device is not to react to this message. After this command the gimbal manager should go back to manual input if available, and otherwise assume a neutral position.
entry.param: Component ID of gimbal device to address (or 1-6 for non-MAVLink gimbal), 0 for all gimbal device components. Send command multiple times for more than one gimbal (but not all gimbals).

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_ROI_SYSID
entry.description: Mount tracks system with specified system ID. Determination of target vehicle position may be done with GLOBAL_POSITION_INT or any other means. This command can be sent to a gimbal manager but not to a gimbal device. A gimbal device is not to react to this message.
entry.param: Component ID of gimbal device to address (or 1-6 for non-MAVLink gimbal), 0 for all gimbal device components. Send command multiple times for more than one gimbal (but not all gimbals).

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_CONTROL_VIDEO
entry.description: Control onboard camera system.
entry.param: Transmission: 0: disabled, 1: enabled compressed, 2: enabled raw
Transmission mode: 0: video stream, >0: single images every n seconds
Recording: 0: disabled, 1: enabled compressed, 2: enabled raw

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_ROI
entry.description: Sets the region of interest (ROI) for a sensor set or the vehicle itself. This can then be used by the vehicle's control system to control the vehicle attitude and the attitude of various sensors such as cameras.
entry.param: Waypoint index/ target ID (depends on param 1).
Region of interest index. (allows a vehicle to manage multiple ROI's)
MAV_ROI_WPNEXT: pitch offset from next waypoint, MAV_ROI_LOCATION: latitude
MAV_ROI_WPNEXT: roll offset from next waypoint, MAV_ROI_LOCATION: longitude
MAV_ROI_WPNEXT: yaw offset from next waypoint, MAV_ROI_LOCATION: altitude

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_DIGICAM_CONFIGURE
entry.description: Configure digital camera. This is a fallback message for systems that have not yet implemented PARAM_EXT_XXX messages and camera definition files (see https://mavlink.io/en/services/camera_def.html ).
entry.param: Modes: P, TV, AV, M, Etc.
Shutter speed: Divisor number for one second.
Main engine cut-off time before camera trigger. (0 means no cut-off)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_DIGICAM_CONTROL
entry.description: Control digital camera. This is a fallback message for systems that have not yet implemented PARAM_EXT_XXX messages and camera definition files (see https://mavlink.io/en/services/camera_def.html ).
entry.param: Zooming step value to offset zoom from the current position
Test shot identifier. If set to 1, image will only be captured, but not counted towards internal frame count.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_MOUNT_CONFIGURE
entry.deprecated: This message has been superseded by MAV_CMD_DO_GIMBAL_MANAGER_CONFIGURE. The message can still be used to communicate with legacy gimbals implementing it.
entry.description: Mission command to configure a camera or antenna mount
entry.param: roll input (0 = angle body frame, 1 = angular rate, 2 = angle absolute frame)
pitch input (0 = angle body frame, 1 = angular rate, 2 = angle absolute frame)
yaw input (0 = angle body frame, 1 = angular rate, 2 = angle absolute frame)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_MOUNT_CONTROL
entry.deprecated: This message is ambiguous and inconsistent. It has been superseded by MAV_CMD_DO_GIMBAL_MANAGER_PITCHYAW and MAV_CMD_DO_SET_ROI_*. The message can still be used to communicate with legacy gimbals implementing it.
entry.description: Mission command to control a camera or antenna mount
entry.param: pitch depending on mount mode (degrees or degrees/second depending on pitch input).
roll depending on mount mode (degrees or degrees/second depending on roll input).
yaw depending on mount mode (degrees or degrees/second depending on yaw input).
latitude, set if appropriate mount mode.
longitude, set if appropriate mount mode.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_CAM_TRIGG_DIST
entry.description: Mission command to set camera trigger distance for this flight. The camera is triggered each time this distance is exceeded. This command can also be used to set the shutter integration time for the camera.
entry.param: Camera trigger distance. 0 to stop triggering.
Camera shutter integration time. -1 or 0 to ignore
Trigger camera once immediately. (0 = no trigger, 1 = trigger)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_FENCE_ENABLE
entry.description: Mission command to enable the geofence

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_PARACHUTE
entry.description: Mission item/command to release a parachute or enable/disable auto release.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_MOTOR_TEST
entry.description: Command to perform motor test.
entry.param: Motor instance number (from 1 to max number of motors on the vehicle).
Throttle type (whether the Throttle Value in param3 is a percentage, PWM value, etc.)
Timeout between tests that are run in sequence.
Motor count. Number of motors to test in sequence: 0/1=one motor, 2= two motors, etc. The Timeout (param4) is used between tests.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_INVERTED_FLIGHT
entry.description: Change to/from inverted flight.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_GRIPPER
entry.description: Mission command to operate a gripper.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_AUTOTUNE_ENABLE
entry.description: Enable/disable autotune.
entry.param: Specify which axis are autotuned. 0 indicates autopilot default settings.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_SET_YAW_SPEED
entry.description: Sets a desired vehicle turn angle and speed change.
entry.param: Yaw angle to adjust steering by.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_CAM_TRIGG_INTERVAL
entry.description: Mission command to set camera trigger interval for this flight. If triggering is enabled, the camera is triggered each time this interval expires. This command can also be used to set the shutter integration time for the camera.
entry.param: Camera trigger cycle time. -1 or 0 to ignore.
Camera shutter integration time. Should be less than trigger cycle time. -1 or 0 to ignore.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_MOUNT_CONTROL_QUAT
entry.description: Mission command to control a camera or antenna mount, using a quaternion as reference.
entry.param: quaternion param q1, w (1 in null-rotation)
quaternion param q2, x (0 in null-rotation)
quaternion param q3, y (0 in null-rotation)
quaternion param q4, z (0 in null-rotation)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_GUIDED_MASTER
entry.description: set id of master controller

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_GUIDED_LIMITS
entry.description: Set limits for external control
entry.param: Timeout - maximum time that external controller will be allowed to control vehicle. 0 means no timeout.
Altitude (MSL) min - if vehicle moves below this alt, the command will be aborted and the mission will continue. 0 means no lower altitude limit.
Altitude (MSL) max - if vehicle moves above this alt, the command will be aborted and the mission will continue. 0 means no upper altitude limit.

Horizontal move limit - if vehicle moves more than this distance from its location at the moment the command was executed, the command will be aborted and the mission will continue. 0 means no horizontal move limit.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_ENGINE_CONTROL
entry.description: Control vehicle engine. This is interpreted by the vehicles engine controller to change the target engine state. It is intended for vehicles with internal combustion engines
entry.param: 0: Warm start, 1:Cold start. Controls use of choke where applicable

Height delay. This is for commanding engine start only after the vehicle has gained the specified height. Used in VTOL vehicles during takeoff to start engine after the aircraft is off the ground. Zero for no delay.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_MISSION_CURRENT
entry.description: Set the mission item with sequence number seq as current item. This means that the MAV will continue to this mission item on the shortest path (not following the mission items in-between).

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_LAST
entry.description: NOP - This command is only used to mark the upper limit of the DO commands in the enumeration

entry.name: MAV_CMD_PREFLIGHT_CALIBRATION
entry.description: Trigger calibration. This command will be only accepted if in pre-flight mode. Except for Temperature Calibration, only one sensor should be set in a single message and all others should be zero.
entry.param: 1: radio RC calibration, 2: RC trim calibration
1: accelerometer calibration, 2: board level calibration, 3: accelerometer temperature calibration, 4: simple accelerometer calibration
1: APM: compass/motor interference calibration (PX4: airspeed calibration, deprecated), 2: airspeed calibration

entry.name: MAV_CMD_PREFLIGHT_SET_SENSOR_OFFSETS
entry.description: Set sensor offsets. This command will be only accepted if in pre-flight mode.
entry.param: Sensor to adjust the offsets for: 0: gyros, 1: accelerometer, 2: magnetometer, 3: barometer, 4: optical flow, 5: second magnetometer, 6: third magnetometer
X axis offset (or generic dimension 1), in the sensor's raw units
Y axis offset (or generic dimension 2), in the sensor's raw units
Z axis offset (or generic dimension 3), in the sensor's raw units
Generic dimension 4, in the sensor's raw units
Generic dimension 5, in the sensor's raw units
Generic dimension 6, in the sensor's raw units

entry.name: MAV_CMD_PREFLIGHT_UAVCAN
entry.description: Trigger UAVCAN configuration (actuator ID assignment and direction mapping). Note that this maps to the legacy UAVCAN v0 function UAVCAN_ENUMERATE, which is intended to be executed just once during initial vehicle configuration (it is not a normal pre-flight command and has been poorly named).
entry.param: 1: Trigger actuator ID assignment and direction mapping. 0: Cancel command.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_PREFLIGHT_STORAGE
entry.description: Request storage of different parameter values and logs. This command will be only accepted if in pre-flight mode.
entry.param: Action to perform on the persistent parameter storage
Action to perform on the persistent mission storage
Onboard logging: 0: Ignore, 1: Start default rate logging, -1: Stop logging, > 1: logging rate (e.g. set to 1000 for 1000 Hz logging)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_PREFLIGHT_REBOOT_SHUTDOWN
entry.description: Request the reboot or shutdown of system components.
entry.param: 0: Do nothing for autopilot, 1: Reboot autopilot, 2: Shutdown autopilot, 3: Reboot autopilot and keep it in the bootloader until upgraded.
0: Do nothing for onboard computer, 1: Reboot onboard computer, 2: Shutdown onboard computer, 3: Reboot onboard computer and keep it in the bootloader until upgraded.
0: Do nothing for component, 1: Reboot component, 2: Shutdown component, 3: Reboot component and keep it in the bootloader until upgraded
MAVLink Component ID targeted in param3 (0 for all components).
WIP: ID (e.g. camera ID -1 for all IDs)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_OVERRIDE_GOTO
entry.description: Override current mission with command to pause mission, pause mission and move to position, continue/resume mission. When param 1 indicates that the mission is paused (MAV_GOTO_DO_HOLD), param 2 defines whether it holds in place or moves to another position.
entry.param: MAV_GOTO_DO_HOLD: pause mission and either hold or move to specified position (depending on param2), MAV_GOTO_DO_CONTINUE: resume mission.
MAV_GOTO_HOLD_AT_CURRENT_POSITION: hold at current position, MAV_GOTO_HOLD_AT_SPECIFIED_POSITION: hold at specified position.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_OBLIQUE_SURVEY
entry.description: Mission command to set a Camera Auto Mount Pivoting Oblique Survey (Replaces CAM_TRIGG_DIST for this purpose). The camera is triggered each time this distance is exceeded, then the mount moves to the next position. Params 4~6 set-up the angle limits and number of positions for oblique survey, where mount-enabled vehicles automatically roll the camera between shots to emulate an oblique camera setup (providing an increased HFOV). This command can also be used to set the shutter integration time for the camera.
entry.param: Camera trigger distance. 0 to stop triggering.
Camera shutter integration time. 0 to ignore
The minimum interval in which the camera is capable of taking subsequent pictures repeatedly. 0 to ignore.
Total number of roll positions at which the camera will capture photos (images captures spread evenly across the limits defined by param5).
Angle limits that the camera can be rolled to left and right of center.
Fixed pitch angle that the camera will hold in oblique mode if the mount is actuated in the pitch axis.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_MISSION_START
entry.description: start running a mission
entry.param: first_item: the first mission item to run
last_item: the last mission item to run (after this item is run, the mission ends)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_ACTUATOR_TEST
entry.description: Actuator testing command. This is similar to MAV_CMD_DO_MOTOR_TEST but operates on the level of output functions, i.e. it is possible to test Motor1 independent from which output it is configured on. Autopilots typically refuse this command while armed.
entry.param: Output value: 1 means maximum positive output, 0 to center servos or minimum motor thrust (expected to spin), -1 for maximum negative (if not supported by the motors, i.e. motor is not reversible, smaller than 0 maps to NaN). And NaN maps to disarmed (stop the motors).

Timeout after which the test command expires and the output is restored to the previous value. A timeout has to be set for safety reasons. A timeout of 0 means to restore the previous value immediately.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_CONFIGURE_ACTUATOR
entry.description: Actuator configuration command.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_COMPONENT_ARM_DISARM
entry.description: Arms / Disarms a component
entry.param: 0: arm-disarm unless prevented by safety checks (i.e. when landed), 21196: force arming/disarming (e.g. allow arming to override preflight checks and disarming in flight)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_RUN_PREARM_CHECKS
entry.description: Instructs a target system to run pre-arm checks. This allows preflight checks to be run on demand, which may be useful on systems that normally run them at low rate, or which do not trigger checks when the armable state might have changed. This command should return MAV_RESULT_ACCEPTED if it will run the checks. The results of the checks are usually then reported in SYS_STATUS messages (this is system-specific). The command should return MAV_RESULT_TEMPORARILY_REJECTED if the system is already armed.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_ILLUMINATOR_ON_OFF
entry.description: Turns illuminators ON/OFF. An illuminator is a light source that is used for lighting up dark areas external to the sytstem: e.g. a torch or searchlight (as opposed to a light source for illuminating the system itself, e.g. an indicator light).

entry.name: MAV_CMD_GET_HOME_POSITION
entry.description: Request the home position from the vehicle. The vehicle will ACK the command and then emit the HOME_POSITION message.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_INJECT_FAILURE
entry.description: Inject artificial failure for testing purposes. Note that autopilots should implement an additional protection before accepting this command such as a specific param setting.
entry.param: The unit which is affected by the failure.
The type how the failure manifests itself.
Instance affected by failure (0 to signal all).

entry.name: MAV_CMD_START_RX_PAIR
entry.description: Starts receiver pairing.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_GET_MESSAGE_INTERVAL
entry.description: Request the interval between messages for a particular MAVLink message ID. The receiver should ACK the command and then emit its response in a MESSAGE_INTERVAL message.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_SET_MESSAGE_INTERVAL
entry.description: Set the interval between messages for a particular MAVLink message ID. This interface replaces REQUEST_DATA_STREAM.
entry.param: The interval between two messages. Set to -1 to disable and 0 to request default rate.
Target address of message stream (if message has target address fields). 0: Flight-stack default (recommended), 1: address of requestor, 2: broadcast.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE
entry.description: Request the target system(s) emit a single instance of a specified message (i.e. a "one-shot" version of MAV_CMD_SET_MESSAGE_INTERVAL).
entry.param: The MAVLink message ID of the requested message.
Use for index ID, if required. Otherwise, the use of this parameter (if any) must be defined in the requested message. By default assumed not used (0).
The use of this parameter (if any), must be defined in the requested message. By default assumed not used (0).
The use of this parameter (if any), must be defined in the requested message. By default assumed not used (0).
The use of this parameter (if any), must be defined in the requested message. By default assumed not used (0).
The use of this parameter (if any), must be defined in the requested message. By default assumed not used (0).
Target address for requested message (if message has target address fields). 0: Flight-stack default, 1: address of requestor, 2: broadcast.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_REQUEST_PROTOCOL_VERSION
entry.description: Request MAVLink protocol version compatibility. All receivers should ACK the command and then emit their capabilities in an PROTOCOL_VERSION message
entry.param: 1: Request supported protocol versions by all nodes on the network

entry.name: MAV_CMD_REQUEST_AUTOPILOT_CAPABILITIES
entry.description: Request autopilot capabilities. The receiver should ACK the command and then emit its capabilities in an AUTOPILOT_VERSION message

entry.name: MAV_CMD_REQUEST_CAMERA_INFORMATION
entry.description: Request camera information (CAMERA_INFORMATION).

entry.name: MAV_CMD_REQUEST_CAMERA_SETTINGS
entry.description: Request camera settings (CAMERA_SETTINGS).

entry.name: MAV_CMD_REQUEST_STORAGE_INFORMATION
entry.description: Request storage information (STORAGE_INFORMATION). Use the command's target_component to target a specific component's storage.
entry.param: Storage ID (0 for all, 1 for first, 2 for second, etc.)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_STORAGE_FORMAT
entry.description: Format a storage medium. Once format is complete, a STORAGE_INFORMATION message is sent. Use the command's target_component to target a specific component's storage.
entry.param: Storage ID (1 for first, 2 for second, etc.)
Format storage (and reset image log). 0: No action 1: Format storage
Reset Image Log (without formatting storage medium). This will reset CAMERA_CAPTURE_STATUS.image_count and CAMERA_IMAGE_CAPTURED.image_index. 0: No action 1: Reset Image Log

entry.name: MAV_CMD_REQUEST_CAMERA_CAPTURE_STATUS
entry.description: Request camera capture status (CAMERA_CAPTURE_STATUS)
entry.param: 0: No Action 1: Request camera capture status

entry.name: MAV_CMD_REQUEST_FLIGHT_INFORMATION
entry.description: Request flight information (FLIGHT_INFORMATION)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_RESET_CAMERA_SETTINGS
entry.description: Reset all camera settings to Factory Default

entry.name: MAV_CMD_SET_CAMERA_MODE
entry.description: Set camera running mode. Use NaN for reserved values. GCS will send a MAV_CMD_REQUEST_VIDEO_STREAM_STATUS command after a mode change if the camera supports video streaming.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_SET_CAMERA_ZOOM
entry.description: Set camera zoom. Camera must respond with a CAMERA_SETTINGS message (on success).
entry.param: Zoom value. The range of valid values depend on the zoom type.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_SET_CAMERA_FOCUS
entry.description: Set camera focus. Camera must respond with a CAMERA_SETTINGS message (on success).

entry.name: MAV_CMD_SET_STORAGE_USAGE
entry.description: Set that a particular storage is the preferred location for saving photos, videos, and/or other media (e.g. to set that an SD card is used for storing videos). There can only be one preferred save location for each particular media type: setting a media usage flag will clear/reset that same flag if set on any other storage. If no flag is set the system should use its default storage. A target system can choose to always use default storage, in which case it should ACK the command with MAV_RESULT_UNSUPPORTED. A target system can choose to not allow a particular storage to be set as preferred storage, in which case it should ACK the command with MAV_RESULT_DENIED.
entry.param: Storage ID (1 for first, 2 for second, etc.)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_JUMP_TAG
entry.description: Tagged jump target. Can be jumped to with MAV_CMD_DO_JUMP_TAG.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_JUMP_TAG
entry.description: Jump to the matching tag in the mission list. Repeat this action for the specified number of times. A mission should contain a single matching tag for each jump. If this is not the case then a jump to a missing tag should complete the mission, and a jump where there are multiple matching tags should always select the one with the lowest mission sequence number.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_GIMBAL_MANAGER_PITCHYAW
entry.description: High level setpoint to be sent to a gimbal manager to set a gimbal attitude. It is possible to set combinations of the values below. E.g. an angle as well as a desired angular rate can be used to get to this angle at a certain angular rate, or an angular rate only will result in continuous turning. NaN is to be used to signal unset. Note: a gimbal is never to react to this command but only the gimbal manager.
entry.param: Pitch angle (positive to pitch up, relative to vehicle for FOLLOW mode, relative to world horizon for LOCK mode).
Yaw angle (positive to yaw to the right, relative to vehicle for FOLLOW mode, absolute to North for LOCK mode).
Yaw rate (positive to yaw to the right).
Component ID of gimbal device to address (or 1-6 for non-MAVLink gimbal), 0 for all gimbal device components. Send command multiple times for more than one gimbal (but not all gimbals).

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_GIMBAL_MANAGER_CONFIGURE
entry.description: Gimbal configuration to set which sysid/compid is in primary and secondary control.
entry.param: Sysid for primary control (0: no one in control, -1: leave unchanged, -2: set itself in control (for missions where the own sysid is still unknown), -3: remove control if currently in control).
Compid for primary control (0: no one in control, -1: leave unchanged, -2: set itself in control (for missions where the own sysid is still unknown), -3: remove control if currently in control).
Sysid for secondary control (0: no one in control, -1: leave unchanged, -2: set itself in control (for missions where the own sysid is still unknown), -3: remove control if currently in control).
Compid for secondary control (0: no one in control, -1: leave unchanged, -2: set itself in control (for missions where the own sysid is still unknown), -3: remove control if currently in control).
Component ID of gimbal device to address (or 1-6 for non-MAVLink gimbal), 0 for all gimbal device components. Send command multiple times for more than one gimbal (but not all gimbals).

entry.name: MAV_CMD_IMAGE_START_CAPTURE
entry.description: Start image capture sequence. Sends CAMERA_IMAGE_CAPTURED after each capture. Use NaN for reserved values.
entry.param: Desired elapsed time between two consecutive pictures (in seconds). Minimum values depend on hardware (typically greater than 2 seconds).
Total number of images to capture. 0 to capture forever/until MAV_CMD_IMAGE_STOP_CAPTURE.

Capture sequence number starting from 1. This is only valid for single-capture (param3 == 1), otherwise set to 0. Increment the capture ID for each capture command to prevent double captures when a command is re-transmitted.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_IMAGE_STOP_CAPTURE
entry.description: Stop image capture sequence Use NaN for reserved values.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_REQUEST_CAMERA_IMAGE_CAPTURE
entry.description: Re-request a CAMERA_IMAGE_CAPTURED message.
entry.param: Sequence number for missing CAMERA_IMAGE_CAPTURED message

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_TRIGGER_CONTROL
entry.description: Enable or disable on-board camera triggering system.
entry.param: Trigger enable/disable (0 for disable, 1 for start), -1 to ignore
1 to reset the trigger sequence, -1 or 0 to ignore
1 to pause triggering, but without switching the camera off or retracting it. -1 to ignore

entry.name: MAV_CMD_CAMERA_TRACK_POINT
entry.description: If the camera supports point visual tracking (CAMERA_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_TRACKING_POINT is set), this command allows to initiate the tracking.
entry.param: Point to track x value (normalized 0..1, 0 is left, 1 is right).
Point to track y value (normalized 0..1, 0 is top, 1 is bottom).
Point radius (normalized 0..1, 0 is image left, 1 is image right).

entry.name: MAV_CMD_CAMERA_TRACK_RECTANGLE
entry.description: If the camera supports rectangle visual tracking (CAMERA_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_TRACKING_RECTANGLE is set), this command allows to initiate the tracking.
entry.param: Top left corner of rectangle x value (normalized 0..1, 0 is left, 1 is right).
Top left corner of rectangle y value (normalized 0..1, 0 is top, 1 is bottom).
Bottom right corner of rectangle x value (normalized 0..1, 0 is left, 1 is right).
Bottom right corner of rectangle y value (normalized 0..1, 0 is top, 1 is bottom).

entry.name: MAV_CMD_CAMERA_STOP_TRACKING
entry.description: Stops ongoing tracking.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_VIDEO_START_CAPTURE
entry.description: Starts video capture (recording).
entry.param: Video Stream ID (0 for all streams)
Frequency CAMERA_CAPTURE_STATUS messages should be sent while recording (0 for no messages, otherwise frequency)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_VIDEO_STOP_CAPTURE
entry.description: Stop the current video capture (recording).
entry.param: Video Stream ID (0 for all streams)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_VIDEO_START_STREAMING
entry.description: Start video streaming
entry.param: Video Stream ID (0 for all streams, 1 for first, 2 for second, etc.)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_VIDEO_STOP_STREAMING
entry.description: Stop the given video stream
entry.param: Video Stream ID (0 for all streams, 1 for first, 2 for second, etc.)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_REQUEST_VIDEO_STREAM_INFORMATION
entry.description: Request video stream information (VIDEO_STREAM_INFORMATION)
entry.param: Video Stream ID (0 for all streams, 1 for first, 2 for second, etc.)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_REQUEST_VIDEO_STREAM_STATUS
entry.description: Request video stream status (VIDEO_STREAM_STATUS)
entry.param: Video Stream ID (0 for all streams, 1 for first, 2 for second, etc.)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_LOGGING_START
entry.description: Request to start streaming logging data over MAVLink (see also LOGGING_DATA message)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_LOGGING_STOP
entry.description: Request to stop streaming log data over MAVLink

entry.name: MAV_CMD_AIRFRAME_CONFIGURATION
entry.param: Landing gear position (Down: 0, Up: 1, NaN for no change)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_CONTROL_HIGH_LATENCY
entry.description: Request to start/stop transmitting over the high latency telemetry
entry.param: Control transmission over high latency telemetry (0: stop, 1: start)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_PANORAMA_CREATE
entry.description: Create a panorama at the current position
entry.param: Viewing angle horizontal of the panorama (+- 0.5 the total angle)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_VTOL_TRANSITION
entry.description: Request VTOL transition
entry.param: The target VTOL state. For normal transitions, only MAV_VTOL_STATE_MC and MAV_VTOL_STATE_FW can be used.

Force immediate transition to the specified MAV_VTOL_STATE. 1: Force immediate, 0: normal transition. Can be used, for example, to trigger an emergency "Quadchute". Caution: Can be dangerous/damage vehicle, depending on autopilot implementation of this command.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_ARM_AUTHORIZATION_REQUEST
entry.description: Request authorization to arm the vehicle to a external entity, the arm authorizer is responsible to request all data that is needs from the vehicle before authorize or deny the request. If approved the progress of command_ack message should be set with period of time that this authorization is valid in seconds or in case it was denied it should be set with one of the reasons in ARM_AUTH_DENIED_REASON.
entry.param: Vehicle system id, this way ground station can request arm authorization on behalf of any vehicle

entry.name: MAV_CMD_SET_GUIDED_SUBMODE_STANDARD
entry.description: This command sets the submode to standard guided when vehicle is in guided mode. The vehicle holds position and altitude and the user can input the desired velocities along all three axes.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_SET_GUIDED_SUBMODE_CIRCLE
entry.description: This command sets submode circle when vehicle is in guided mode. Vehicle flies along a circle facing the center of the circle. The user can input the velocity along the circle and change the radius. If no input is given the vehicle will hold position.
entry.param: Radius of desired circle in CIRCLE_MODE
Target latitude of center of circle in CIRCLE_MODE
Target longitude of center of circle in CIRCLE_MODE

entry.name: MAV_CMD_CONDITION_GATE
entry.description: Delay mission state machine until gate has been reached.
entry.param: Geometry: 0: orthogonal to path between previous and next waypoint.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_FENCE_RETURN_POINT
entry.description: Fence return point (there can only be one such point in a geofence definition). If rally points are supported they should be used instead.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_FENCE_POLYGON_VERTEX_INCLUSION
entry.description: Fence vertex for an inclusion polygon (the polygon must not be self-intersecting). The vehicle must stay within this area. Minimum of 3 vertices required.
entry.param: Vehicle must be inside ALL inclusion zones in a single group, vehicle must be inside at least one group, must be the same for all points in each polygon

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_FENCE_POLYGON_VERTEX_EXCLUSION
entry.description: Fence vertex for an exclusion polygon (the polygon must not be self-intersecting). The vehicle must stay outside this area. Minimum of 3 vertices required.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_FENCE_CIRCLE_INCLUSION
entry.description: Circular fence area. The vehicle must stay inside this area.
entry.param: Vehicle must be inside ALL inclusion zones in a single group, vehicle must be inside at least one group

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_FENCE_CIRCLE_EXCLUSION
entry.description: Circular fence area. The vehicle must stay outside this area.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_RALLY_POINT
entry.description: Rally point. You can have multiple rally points defined.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_UAVCAN_GET_NODE_INFO
entry.description: Commands the vehicle to respond with a sequence of messages UAVCAN_NODE_INFO, one message per every UAVCAN node that is online. Note that some of the response messages can be lost, which the receiver can detect easily by checking whether every received UAVCAN_NODE_STATUS has a matching message UAVCAN_NODE_INFO received earlier; if not, this command should be sent again in order to request re-transmission of the node information messages.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_ADSB_OUT_IDENT
entry.description: Trigger the start of an ADSB-out IDENT. This should only be used when requested to do so by an Air Traffic Controller in controlled airspace. This starts the IDENT which is then typically held for 18 seconds by the hardware per the Mode A, C, and S transponder spec.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_PAYLOAD_PREPARE_DEPLOY
entry.description: Deploy payload on a Lat / Lon / Alt position. This includes the navigation to reach the required release position and velocity.
entry.param: Operation mode. 0: prepare single payload deploy (overwriting previous requests), but do not execute it. 1: execute payload deploy immediately (rejecting further deploy commands during execution, but allowing abort). 2: add payload deploy to existing deployment list.
Desired approach vector in compass heading. A negative value indicates the system can define the approach vector at will.
Desired ground speed at release time. This can be overridden by the airframe in case it needs to meet minimum airspeed. A negative value indicates the system can define the ground speed at will.
Minimum altitude clearance to the release position. A negative value indicates the system can define the clearance at will.
Latitude. Note, if used in MISSION_ITEM (deprecated) the units are degrees (unscaled)
Longitude. Note, if used in MISSION_ITEM (deprecated) the units are degrees (unscaled)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_PAYLOAD_CONTROL_DEPLOY
entry.description: Control the payload deployment.
entry.param: Operation mode. 0: Abort deployment, continue normal mission. 1: switch to payload deployment mode. 100: delete first payload deployment request. 101: delete all payload deployment requests.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_FIXED_MAG_CAL_YAW
entry.description: Magnetometer calibration based on provided known yaw. This allows for fast calibration using WMM field tables in the vehicle, given only the known yaw of the vehicle. If Latitude and longitude are both zero then use the current vehicle location.
entry.param: Yaw of vehicle in earth frame.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_WINCH
entry.description: Command to operate winch.
entry.param: Length of line to release (negative to wind).

entry.name: MAV_CMD_WAYPOINT_USER_1
entry.description: User defined waypoint item. Ground Station will show the Vehicle as flying through this item.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_WAYPOINT_USER_2
entry.description: User defined waypoint item. Ground Station will show the Vehicle as flying through this item.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_WAYPOINT_USER_3
entry.description: User defined waypoint item. Ground Station will show the Vehicle as flying through this item.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_WAYPOINT_USER_4
entry.description: User defined waypoint item. Ground Station will show the Vehicle as flying through this item.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_WAYPOINT_USER_5
entry.description: User defined waypoint item. Ground Station will show the Vehicle as flying through this item.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_SPATIAL_USER_1
entry.description: User defined spatial item. Ground Station will not show the Vehicle as flying through this item. Example: ROI item.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_SPATIAL_USER_2
entry.description: User defined spatial item. Ground Station will not show the Vehicle as flying through this item. Example: ROI item.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_SPATIAL_USER_3
entry.description: User defined spatial item. Ground Station will not show the Vehicle as flying through this item. Example: ROI item.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_SPATIAL_USER_4
entry.description: User defined spatial item. Ground Station will not show the Vehicle as flying through this item. Example: ROI item.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_SPATIAL_USER_5
entry.description: User defined spatial item. Ground Station will not show the Vehicle as flying through this item. Example: ROI item.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_USER_1
entry.description: User defined command. Ground Station will not show the Vehicle as flying through this item. Example: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_PARAMETER item.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_USER_2
entry.description: User defined command. Ground Station will not show the Vehicle as flying through this item. Example: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_PARAMETER item.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_USER_3
entry.description: User defined command. Ground Station will not show the Vehicle as flying through this item. Example: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_PARAMETER item.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_USER_4
entry.description: User defined command. Ground Station will not show the Vehicle as flying through this item. Example: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_PARAMETER item.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_USER_5
entry.description: User defined command. Ground Station will not show the Vehicle as flying through this item. Example: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_PARAMETER item.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_CAN_FORWARD
entry.description: Request forwarding of CAN packets from the given CAN bus to this component. CAN Frames are sent using CAN_FRAME and CANFD_FRAME messages
entry.param: Bus number (0 to disable forwarding, 1 for first bus, 2 for 2nd bus, 3 for 3rd bus).
